website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy, stainless steel spare tire carrier that will fit most tires easily.
pros: Stainless steel construction with durable powder-coat finish
cons: A few users have complained of difficulty fitting larger 5-lug wheels onto the carrier

customer_reviews.title: Beware of weld and quality of metal
customer_reviews.text: Bought it a year ago. Upon inspection while transporting I found it hanging on by a thread of weld. If I had driven over it would have made a real mess. Think it was poorly welded.
customer_reviews.author: TVJ

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but youll need an extension socket for sure
customer_reviews.text: Very good product but be prepared to get some tools to unbolt the spare because the stud bolts are way too long. The other thing I noticed that these are regular steel bolts for mounting. They will rush very fast. Would have been better if they were zink plated. See my pictures for a standard lug wrench will not work. I used a saw all and cut the bolts to 1 1/4 to make them work. Don't forget to leave the nut on to re-thread the bolt after it's cut.
customer_reviews.author: G. Singer

customer_reviews.title: Product didn’t fit the size wheels it describes, disappointing ...
customer_reviews.text: Product didn’t fit the size wheels it describes, disappointing, waited on these to finish a trailer rebuild and now I’m waiting again. Update, product is good quality, just didn’t fit as described, I had ended up having to drill a grid hole to allow it to fit my wheels, didn’t have time to wait for a new one to be shipped and no one local has any.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation. Versatile Mounting.
customer_reviews.text: I used to mount spare on jet ski trailer. I mounted on inside rail to maintain turning clearance. Easy to adjust bracket to desired location. So far, all good.
customer_reviews.author: A Ski Doo Rider

customer_reviews.title: Required re-engineering.
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit my 5 hole wheel: 14-inch rim (215/75R14 tire). Had to extend one of the square hole about 1/8" to get it to fit. Also, the carrier does not have wheel studs pressed in, rather it uses carriage bolts., which means that you must hold the tire up, slide in a carriage bolt from the back of the carrier, then screw on the lug nut. Takes a lot of effort to perform what should be a simple task. So I spot welded the heads of the carriage bolts to the back side of the carrier plate. Other than all that, made well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Boy4dirt

customer_reviews.title: which I love, and I wanted a spare
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 5 x 8 trailer from TSC, which I love, and I wanted a spare. For $12 this was 1/3 the price that TSC wanted for the carrier (I also got the spare from Amazon for 1/2 what TSC charged). This comes with brackets with lots of different hole spacings to bolt to the tongue of the trailer. I had already added a cheap trailer jack from HF, and I was able to re-arrange the brackets so that both the trailer jack on the left and the spare tire on the right could share the same mounting bolts. This worked really well and saved space. A great deal at this price, sturdy and well finished.
customer_reviews.author: ken wells

customer_reviews.title: Does not Fit 5 on 5 Trailer Wheel
customer_reviews.text: I measured my trailer wheel's bolt pattern before purchase confirming it was a 5 on 5 as outlined in the description. Once I received the product, mounted it to the trailer, then tried to mount the wheel. No matter what bolt configuration I attempted the holes wouldn't line up. I had to drill another hole in the plate in order to get this to work without having to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Make sure that you measure the Bolt-Hole Pattern of your Wheel Rim, before ordering!
customer_reviews.text: This Spare Tire Mount works perfect on my trailer. This mount was very easy for me to install, and works perfectly to hold my spare tire onto my trailer tongue. This Carrier WORKS PERFECTLY to hold my 15" Spare Tire onto my trailer. A warning to potential customers; make sure you measure the bolt-hole pattern on your spare tire prior to ordering this Carrier! ALTHOUGH this Carrier is advetized as "UNIVERSAL Design" --- This Carrier's shipping box states: "NOT COMPATIBLE with 5 on 4 3/4", or 5 on 5" Bolt Pattern."! My 15" spare tire has 5-bolt-holes with a 4.5" bolt-pattern; so this Carrier WORKS PERFECT for my Spare Tire!
customer_reviews.author: Namgrunt66

customer_reviews.title: Ordered Twice. Both shipments missing same parts.
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived quickly but the two nylon lock nuts were not included. When the second carrier arrived, carton undamaged, no lock nuts. Drove to two dealers of standard and specialty Nuts, Bolts, etc. Neither could match the thread pattern of the bolts trying both metric and American sizes so I had to buy bolts, lock nuts, washers, lock washers, and regular nuts in order to mount the tire on the carrier. The item does not include any Lock or Security Features which is why I gave one star. The carrier itself mounts easily to a utility trailer in several places. It is secure as long as the bolts are checked from time-to-time. I am satisfied with the product otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: HickoryC

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other offerings costing two or three times the cost of this MaxxHaul product, this is a great deal. It is sturdy, and the hardware is metric 8.8. It is also powder coated, so rust should not be an issue. The only difficulty is the loose mount wheel attachment studs; I used JB Weld to affix the studs (carriage bolts) to the bracket, making it a breeze to hang the spare on for running up the included lug nuts. Appreciated the over-length attachment bolts as I have side rails on my trailer, and this allowed the carrier to be spaced out about 1 inch.
customer_reviews.author: AJK

customer_reviews.title: The only words that fit this are four letter!
customer_reviews.text: 1st it is a royal pain to put on the trailer. 2nd it's even more of a pain mounting the spare to it than putting the device on the trailer to begin with! There is no way to put the wheel studs on the mount so that they will stay on. So anytime you take the wheel off, the mounting studs come off with it! They could have at least supplied a couple of nuts to actually attach the studs instead of just letting them hang lose and push out as soon as you try to mount the tire. Guess I'll be making a trip to the hardware store to buy hardware that SHOULD have come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver H Perry

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little item that is well made
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little item that is well made. It comes with all mounting hardware and can fit almost all size rims. It comes powder coated which is huge for a marine item. It was able to hold a 15" steel rim with tire very easily. I highly recommend this product. Pro's: Solid Powder coated Size Strength Con's: The wheel mounting studs are not fixed (which allows for it to be semi universal) but it can make it hard to install and remove the wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: OK, but cheap looking.
customer_reviews.text: Works good, a little flimsy looking, could not mount on my utility car hauler trailer, won't fit over 4" channel iron frame as pictured, had to drill 4 holes and through bolt them welded plates are not exactly square with each other, with tire mounted, tire is not parallel to trailer look a little odd, held tire fine though on a 5500 mile trip.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: I think this spare tire holder is amazing. I am surprised it was only $13. dollars. I have a 5 lug 15” tire and it fit perfectly. The directions were very easy to follow. I installed mine while still in my pajamas this evening with a pair of channel locks. Before buying I went to the internet and asked how to measure the wheel. I found a site that explains it with words and pictures for a 4 or 5 lug wheel. They even provide a downloadable ruler to make it even easier to measure. Etrailer.com
customer_reviews.author: Dragontamerz

customer_reviews.title: Not for 15" tires unless your trailer frame is unusually high.
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the other reviews. I'm not sure what size tire that they have pictured. I own a Haulmark motorcycle trailer and a 15" tire is less than 4" off of the ground. No way that I can put it on the road like that. The mount puts the center hole of the tire slightly above the frame, so consider the clearance before buying. The hole pattern fits a 5x4.5 pattern rim perfectly, but due to the amount of rise it is a no more than scrap of metal for me. It might be great for a tire that is 12" or less...
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: Its affordable, but little more.
customer_reviews.text: I liked very little about this product, but it is affordable. The fasteners are garbage and I had to modify everything about it to make it fir my wheel and trailer. The bolt pattern will NOT fit the most common 5 lug pattern and you should upgrade the fasteners because they are not quite as strong as tin foil. But, if you have the capabilities to fix these issues but dont have a welder to make your own, this is an alright product.
customer_reviews.author: LAW74

customer_reviews.title: You'll need a spacer with rims over 6" width with normal size tires. 8"-13" wheels work perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: This would work very well on narrower trailer tires with 13 inch wheels or less. I had to add a 1/4" wheel spacer to get a full sized rim and tire from a Cadillac CTS without pressing against the trailer frame. Very simple installation. It comes with instructions although I didn't look at them. The thickness and the coating make this look like it's going to last a very long time. I would also suggest tack welding the back of the lug nuts in place as they are not permanently attached and make it slightly difficult to install and remove tires from it. Fits 4 and 5 lug Wheels.
customer_reviews.author: BigStik

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, Effective, Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: First off, if you are like the top reviewer and can't get this installed easily with a 6 point 3/4" socket and an 11/16" wrench you probably shouldn't be working on anything, lol. My socket never slipped, easy peasy. Took all of 5 minutes to install and mount tire. Does the exact same thing the $50 ones do for 1/4 the price. Wheel studs are standard 1/2" and use a standard 3/4" socket identical to the lug studs on most trailers with 4 or 5 lug wheels. If I have a need for one again I would buy again in a heartbeat. I will update this review if I ever have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: TBigLug

customer_reviews.title: Quick install and holds my spares securely.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was really easy and quick. I installed two so I'd have two spares. They hold very securely. My 5x4.5" wheels fit ok, but the bolt holes on these brackets seem to have been measured in metric to "close enough" standards because they aren't quite perfect and the bolts aren't quite straight when going through the wheels. Only four stars because of the "close enough" measurement.
customer_reviews.author: SEOMike

customer_reviews.title: Should have been an easy install; mounts low.
customer_reviews.text: This should have been an easy install. Study picture and use that to install, but don't necessarily use their location for the bolts. Pay attention to order of washers. Also, you're going to want to put this high up as possible; after doing this it still seems too close to the ground. It's lower than the trailer hitch, and that already scraps when going over sudden change in gradient.
customer_reviews.author: John Q. Public I

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work on 5 x 5" Wheel
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work with a 5 x 5" wheel maybe a 5 on 4 1/2" wheel. Bought 2 but don't want to go through the hassle of returning it. Specifically this wheel. The wheel fit perfectly on my trailer. Southwest Wheel 15" x 5" Silver Modular Trailer...
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P.

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy to Install - Works with 4 or 5 Bolt Pattern
customer_reviews.text: This spare trailer tire mount was super easy to install. It comes with two skinny brackets that have the same number of holes that attach to the front mounting plate that holds the tire. Simply select the holes that lineup so you can mount the spare tire holder on to the tongue of the trailer securely without slack. There are four bolts that each have a washer, a lock nut, and a nut. On the tire side there are two bolts that have square backs with a washer, locknut, and nut.
customer_reviews.author: Tried the Product

customer_reviews.title: Good product, well made, would have liked exterior lug nuts to be included
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price, exactly what I hoped it would be. Took about 10 minutes to install, and should work perfectly for my needs. One note, I suppose everyone else has the exterior lug nuts required to hold the spare on the rack....but I didn't, which required a trip to the auto parts shop to buy. It would have been convenient (and I would have gladly paid the buck more) to have those two lug nuts included with the hardware.....
customer_reviews.author: The Hovelsmithy

customer_reviews.title: Won't work on an angle iron framed trailer.
customer_reviews.text: My utility trailer is framed with angle iron (L shape). This tire carrier will only work with a square or rectangular tube framed trailer. It needs a solid surface both front and back. Had I spent more time closely inspecting the photo of this $10 purchase, I would have seen that. Or, had I read all the way to Question #52 of the Customer Questions, I would also have learned that. BUT, angle iron trailers are common enough that the product description should have stated this limitation/incompatability; thus, the two stars. Someday, I'll take the time to find a way to make it work, probably with a block of wood, but still . . . .
customer_reviews.author: J-Stroke

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Not the highest quality, but plenty sturdy for the job it does. The product description says zinc plated hardware, but it came with standard steel. Other reviewers noted the same, and I do expect the bolts to rust. I painted it to match my trailer after install, including bolts. That should protect for awhile. As with many trailer accessories, they have to be modified to fit, so I went with the least expensive product knowing that I would make changes to suit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Rikabod

customer_reviews.title: Decent product... However, luckily it doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent product... However, luckily it doesn't have to do much other than hold a tire. The welds are poorly done, powder coating is ok on most of the product but not the underside. Lastly, wish they would have used a standard trailer lug nut for the tire mounting studs. I had to go out and buy two new ones so I could use my lug wrench for all the trailer tires.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This product is not good the tire holder it’s self is cheap but the metal it was made from broke in half wish I would have taken a picture but I did not. Save your money and buy a better one spend more for a better quality this was holding a boat spare tire
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Webster

customer_reviews.title: 5x20 spare on roof basket and works awesome and bolt pattern worked for 2 lugs on sport ...
customer_reviews.text: used it to mount a 33x12.5x20 spare on roof basket and works awesome and bolt pattern worked for 2 lugs on sport trac wheel, notched the bottom plate to mount on rack so would not slide, for price it works amazing,i was not sure if it would work but yakima and others wanted 180 bucks for there design, did not use there long bolts they supplied, went with short bolts.the extension was perfect for my tire, was a 3/4 from rim but once you tighten the two lugs it snugged to perfection giving a solid feel.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, but cheap.
customer_reviews.text: This is a budget unit good for small rims on a utility trailer or similar. I would NOT push the limits with this thing, hang a big spare on it and cannonball across county. SPEND MORE MONEY! However, it has it’s place in the market. Welds are not as garish as the ones I’ve seen in some other people’s pics. They aren’t the greatest thing I’ve seen either though. Powder coat finish seems to be holding up fine. Install is obviously very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I tried the traditional U bolt mount first, but the tire ended up being too low on my utility trailer so I switched to this which was cheaper than the U bolt anyway. Raised the tire up another few inches and works perfectly for me. The only complaint is that there are supposed to be two more nuts to secure the studs to the mount but they were not in my kit. I'll spend the 45 cents to get them next time I'm at the HD.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Weak Metal
customer_reviews.text: Just purchase this 8 May 2020 and installed it today. I tried to tighten the bolts to manufacture suggestion 40 foot pounds. The photos show that it actually bent the steel plate and I had to stop before I snapped the metal. I agree with others that this is to thin of a metal to feel confident that it won’t break or cause damage while hauling down the highway. Not asking for a refund because of the price but I’ll never purchase again or recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Tights

customer_reviews.title: Not the best setup for installation
customer_reviews.text: Hmmm...Not the best setup for installation. The mounting frame is cumbersome and just doesn't hold the mounting frame tight to the trailer. I tried mounting several different ways without success. Not a bad price to give it a try. As mentioned in many reviews the tire mount to the tire are off centered and hard to line up. I was able to mount the tire properly after several attempts.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: like many enclosed cargo trailers have
customer_reviews.text: This is simple to install, and is quite solidly built. What kept me from giving it five stars is that it is somewhat difficult to line up a five lug wheel with the mounting bolts. Also, if you have a trailer with a very low tongue, like many enclosed cargo trailers have, this will probably not work, as it does not get the tire high enough off the ground in that application. Given the right application, this unit is good, and very inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Dingo

customer_reviews.title: looks good easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Stared to return this item but used it on a different trailer -- easy to install and fits perfectly. Little aggravating that they used different size bolts to attach to trailer and to attach the tire. One is a 3/4 standard the other is a 18 mm . Need to carry two wrenches instead of one.
customer_reviews.author: jonesr2

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality unit.
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed in my research, because I thought this would side-mount to the trailer bed. Nope, it's intended for the trailer tongue as advertised. Fits well, I step across the tongue a lot and didn't want to contend with a tire mounted there. I'll probably modify later. I reamed the jack mount holes for the supplied 3/8" bolts and bolted the holder to the opposite side (see photo). Good quality, nice welds, thick material, 3/8" dia bolts, built to last. A little over-engineered for a small spare tire, but I'm okay with that. Buy this.
customer_reviews.author: John Gausta

customer_reviews.title: Scrap Metal
customer_reviews.text: JUNK, GARBAGE, -------, That's the best i got for this. Will not bolt to my trailer. I even went out and spent $20 on shorter bolts. Still could not get it to bolt up without 1/2 spacers. THIS PRODUCT WILL NOT FIT ALL TRAILERS. Especially ones like I have(1 3/8 by 3inch) channel iron. So, I threw it in the garbage. C'est La vie. Good Luck All!!!
customer_reviews.author: Running Wolf

customer_reviews.title: super strong
customer_reviews.text: This tire carrier arrived yesterday and was installed today. Seldom is there such a wide gap between a low price and a high quality product. The metal frame is very thick and strong. Attachment hardware is first quality. This thing will probably outlast your trailer.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: You need to know this!!
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying this product to place on the back of a travel trailer, be sure that you will have the clearance from the bottom of the spare to the ground. I did not realize this until after I bought the wrong thing. This issue was in no way the fault of the product, seller or Amazon. This was completely on me for not checking the clearances. As far as the security goes, I just put a length of chain and a lock on it. Works just fine. Happy trails.
customer_reviews.author: chuck crabbe

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you use lock tight
customer_reviews.text: I installed it on my trailer and attached spare tire to it. Everything looked good until it started falling off. The bolts stripped so I couldn't get my spare tire off. It was a disaster. if you want to use this product I would recommend using loctite on all the bolts and nuts and maybe even doubling them up with two nuts on each bolt, there is a lot of vibration from driving down the road and the bolts just work themselves loose strip out.
customer_reviews.author: sc

customer_reviews.title: Secure, well made tire mount for a trailer/camper
customer_reviews.text: I had to remove my Aliner trailer tire and mount to the front hitch area. This mount is well made and mounts the spare to the trailer very securely. Because the mounts have numerous hole mounts it is quite easy to set up the mount and then lock down the wheel/tire to the system. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Slight modifications needed but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Can’t beat this mount for the price but I did have to modify it 2 different ways to get it to fit. With the L channel side rails, I have to use a block as a filler between the bracket and the trailer sides. Another person mentioned this and I did the same thing he did. The other thing was the holes didn’t line up with my wheel so I had to drill another hole to get the wheel mounted. Aside from that, great product!
customer_reviews.author: StlAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and fit my spare perfect. I did tack weld the wheel studs to the plate, with the wheel off I was worried they would fall out. Maybe instead of a loose fit a better design would have the holes be a press fit. I bent over the bolts that hold it to the trailer frame, so the whole mount can not be taken off easily. I added a set of locking lug nuts, so all three wheels on my trailer are locked.
customer_reviews.author: trixie

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Heavy  Built,  and Relatively Inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: The easiest way to mount a spare on a utility trailer. For a standard lug wrench to fit onto the lug nuts once tightened, one may need to place two flat washers and one lock washer between the wheel and each lug nut. Using the spacers, the wheel holds as tight if not tighter as if they were not used. I did not use the attached frame bracket but bolted mine directly on the front of my utility trailer with carriage bolts through the 2 inch wood trailer sides plus another two inch thick square piece of wood as a front backing plate for additional strength and clearance. As solid and secure as a spare tire can be.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Quick Install, Seems Rugged
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to install on my travel trailer's rear bumper. One important thing to know is the bolts are not long enough to install it on a 4" square bumper. I'm not taking any stars as it shows it being installed on a cargo trailer frame. Once I got bolts that are 1/2" longer, it went on easily. Seems a lot sturdier than the spare tire carrier I had on it before.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: Easy install but didn't last. Made it one way on our first trip but the wheel holder was bent and looked like it had gone through hell. Bad enough that I just removed the spare and placed it flat on the trailer on the return trip. May try to clamp it vertically on the bed of the trailer just to keep the spare room being loose but won't place it on the side again as I fear it just falling apart on the highway and losing my spare.
customer_reviews.author: Manny Lopez

customer_reviews.title: It holds the tire
customer_reviews.text: It holds the tire on the trailer. Had to use a few inches of spare chainlink fence post to run the bottom mounting bolts through, otherwise it would have been mounted at an angle. This modification let me mount the bracket level. No way to actually lock the wheel on without running a cable and lock through it. I painted the assembly up in black spray paint after I was done to blend the hardware in with the trailer frame.
customer_reviews.author: Jake M.

customer_reviews.title: Good for a light boat trailer
customer_reviews.text: This easy-to-install spare tire carrier is much better than the u-bolt around the frame method that the builder thought was adequate. I went to the hardware store to get a couple of inexpensive press-on clips to hold the two bolts in place while the spare is going on or off. In a high-crime area I would figure out a way to lock the wheel in place--probably just a chain and padlock.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis L. Allen

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty; no lock feature
customer_reviews.text: The rating has "Lock feature" and "security" - not sure why, because there isn't any locking method. It is normally mounted on the hitch bar, but I built a box on the trailer and mounted it on the front of the box. NOTE: CASE HARDENED STEEL. This is good for the construction. I tried drilling a hole a bit bigger - steel is tough
customer_reviews.author: mr_bandit

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat for the price . . .
customer_reviews.text: Simple mounting solution for the spare tire. I think it'd be difficult to find a cheaper alternative unless you fabricated one in you welding shop. Very well made, included all necessary hardware, and seems extremely well built. The mounting holes and included bolts should allow fitment to a variety of frame sizes. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lee B.

customer_reviews.title: Great value....
customer_reviews.text: This is the same tire carrier that Harbor Freight sells, except it was 1/2 the price. Used this to mount a spare on my teardrop camper & I could't be happier. I did use a block of 2x4 to space it out from the tongue of my trailer, this was because I needed a little extra space to clear my tongue box. Would buy again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: Great Trailer Spare Tire Holder
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to mount to boat trailer and is great in that it can be used for different tire sizes. I had it on my boat trailer with a 13" spare tire and on my utility trailer with a 15" spare and in both cases it works great. Gives you the flexibility to mount just about anywhere on trailers to fit your need.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This spare tire carrier was just as advertised and a real value. One design changes is warranted. The bolts that hold the tire to the carrier are not fixed. As such, if you were to change a flat in the dark you would likely lose the bolts on the side of the road when you removed the tire. An inside nut on the lug bolts would do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The mounting bracket is not square with the bracket that attaches to the trailer. Once you install the tire, the bracket throws the tire out from the trailer by at least 25 degrees. I wanted this to work. If the tire road inline with the trailer I would have no problem keeping it. unfortunately this doesn't work. if your goal is to just have a spare on the trailer then buy this bracket but if you need it too look good and be functional then don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: nice but missing parts
customer_reviews.text: easy to bolt on, but couldn't understand why it came with two extra washers and lockwashers until i realized it was missing two bolts to hold the carriage bolts in place when you bolt the spare tire on. one more bolt hole and it would fit a 5" bolt pattern too. i drilled it out and used a dremel to hold mine .
customer_reviews.author: Ige Gustavson

customer_reviews.title: Functional tire mount for a low cost
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a bargain. It’s simple in design but robust enough for my 12” spare. Easy to install it took 10 minutes and that included pre-greasing bolts. Worked perfect on my 5x8 Lowe’s trailer. This was 1/3 the price of others I looked at. I honestly am very happy with the purchase. I would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Beetle

customer_reviews.title: Nice but may not line up with your spacing
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is constructed well. I welded it into a special bracket I built for my trailer rather than using clamp bolts. The problem I encountered was that the bolt spacing didn't line up. I have a 5 lug wheel that had bolt spacing around 5.75" but the plate was set up for a 5 lug with about a 5.25" spacing. I ended up drilling a hole that matched my spacing. Not a big deal but it would have been nice to have it come that way.
customer_reviews.author: J Doherty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, nice quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very nice spare mount. Worked great on my boat trailer and my 4 Lug spare. For the price, I was rather impressed with the quality of this mount as its made of heavy steal and the hardware seemed really decent and heavy. Everything fit together perfectly and as described.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Delivered Next Day!
customer_reviews.text: Next day shipping....Incredibly Fast. Quality product for the price. Pretty easy to install, I did use locktite even with the lock washers. And I had to use a hacksaw to cut the two bottom hex bolts because they would have hit the spare tire. We’ll see how it lasts on our 700 mile trip later this week. So far, it looks like a good product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Critical Customer

customer_reviews.title: Met the need
customer_reviews.text: I needed a simple bolt-on solution for a spare-tire mount on my utility trailer. This item is exactly that. And it was inexpensive, too. Note it has no intrinsic security or locking mechanism; it's just a carry mount. If one needs to secure the spare a cable lock would do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amphion612

customer_reviews.title: Great price and value
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be a great spare tire holder, and you cannot beat the price. Some reviews state that they did not fit well on their wheels. I needed a holder for a boat trailer and a utility trailer which had different sized wheels. Boat trailer had 4.80 8 tires with 5 lug pattern, utility trailer has 205/75-15 with 6lug pattern. This holder fit both of them without any problem. I ended using it on my boat trailer. I will be buying the same holder for my utility trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Cat

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: For the small wheels my trailer takes I trimmed the corners of the square where the tire mounts so the wheel sat completely flat. It was well made and plenty strong. No lock on this one nut I knew that when I purchased. 5 stars because it's built well and it would have worked without my modification.
customer_reviews.author: JamesR

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews stating it may require some minor tweaks I purchased it anyway knowing I was going to modify it anyway. Weld in one of the carriage bolts so you don't have to hold the tire while mounting and attach a loop to lock the tire in (sad but necessary now a days) For the money it looks well made and being a universal mount it offers versatility in installation.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas P Czechowicz

customer_reviews.title: Super great value
customer_reviews.text: If I had a welder, i could have made this, but it still would have cost me more of my time than this wheel mount cost. So it is totally worth the $13.05 I paid, probably even more. It comes with lock washers, of which i am a huge fan. It made the install so much easier than if lock nuts had been included.
customer_reviews.author: chadjason

customer_reviews.title: MaxxHaul rocks
customer_reviews.text: This is my second MaxxHaul product. great descriptions, good products, great price. I dont mind, often prefer to buy products that I can improve or modify to suit my needs. Often I can buy a close product for about the cost of raw materials, so maybe 80% of the work is done. Very happy with this vendor
customer_reviews.author: owen

customer_reviews.title: Works well with a few tweaks
customer_reviews.text: Mounting bolts were extra long. I reversed the orientation from picture so they point towards the spare tire. That way they don’t interfere with items loaded on trailer. I also added a piece of 2x2 wood along the trailer frame where this was mounted for extra stability.
customer_reviews.author: Pourparler7

customer_reviews.title: My brother had just a cheap setup where his spare ...
customer_reviews.text: My brother had just a cheap setup where his spare was mounted on top of the trailer tongue. Made it awkward to jump on the trailer tongue to hook up his boat to the winch strap. I bought him one of these and now I can balance beam it all the way to his truck if I want and it keeps the tire from being torqued against the tongue which is an added bonus in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I chose this style of mount because I didn't want the tire resting on the frame. The cost was very reasonable especially when compared to the basic u-bolt style mount with the added bonus of three bolts to hold the tire. I used this to mount my spare tire horizontally on a tow dolly and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: rondrei

customer_reviews.title: Great tire holder for the price
customer_reviews.text: So this was super easy to install on my trailer and I am glad to have my spare tire out of the back of my truck. Tire is super sturdy on the trailer as well. This is a no brainer if you are looking for a good cheap tire holder. I used it on a 2001 Shore Lander trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Williams

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy way to be prepared for unexpected blowouts!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what my husband wanted and at a price he was okay paying. Worked great on our trailer and now we have a spare in tow at all times! No more being stranded by the side of a busy 4 lane highway waiting for over an hour while a call is made to home and a replacement tire is located and borrowed from a neighbor and transported to the site and replaced. Yes, that happened and that is exactly whey we promptly ordered this spare tire holder immediately afterwards. It was a quick, affordable, and easy way to be prepared for any unexpected blowouts. Problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Good, inexpensive tire carrier
customer_reviews.text: I received the carrier today. It fit well and I had no problem with my 5 hole trailer spare. My only complaint is the support bars are curved on each end making it difficult to get any kind of socket or wrench on the bolt head to tighten it. I did manage after a few minutes but the design of the bars could be done in such a way to allow easier access to tighten.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat
customer_reviews.text: Look at the price! For what it is. Cant beat it. Works perfectly for my jetski trailer tire, I didn’t trust the material against rusting so I sprayed it with Black Flexseal Rubber Coating I had and some black spray paint I had over that. I suspect should hold up
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on an ACME EZE Tow car dolly.
customer_reviews.text: The spare tire when mounted on the holder hits the frame of the dolly and is not able to be tightened down. The carrier needs to be about 1.5 inches longer to move the 205/65/10 tire away from the frame. I'll try to return this but I fear shipping costs will exceed the cost of the item. Overall the item seems well made and I do agree with the reviewer about the different size bolt heads and nuts being a different size making it a challenge to tighten down.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not safe.
customer_reviews.text: This bracket failed after two fishing trips It literally broke in half where The wheel bolts to the bracket with three bolts. Only one bolt was holding the wheel, keeping it from careening across the highway into traffic or pedestrians. It did, however, last long enough to not be returnable.
customer_reviews.author: William H.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad; I think this will work fine
customer_reviews.text: I had to go on-line to find pictures of where to mount it; would have been nice had the directions included that. I will get 2 more nuts to secure the bolts onto which the wheel mounts because otherwise taking it on/off will be a pain forever. Other than that I think it'll work fine now that it's on.
customer_reviews.author: jvinIowee

customer_reviews.title: Good for Boat Trailer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this spare tire mount for a boat trailer. It was an easy install, looks good and securely holds the spare tire. My only complaint is that I wish had the same size nuts as those on the trailer. You have to carry an additional socket.
customer_reviews.author: 1kyfool

customer_reviews.title: Good spare tire mount
customer_reviews.text: Pushes the spare tire out about 4" and up from the trailer frame. Good quality an looks like it will last. I would say it doesn't angle the tire like I was hoping so I could mount it near the bow of the boat. Still looks like a good product.
customer_reviews.author: pac

customer_reviews.title: Poor execution of good design
customer_reviews.text: This is to narrow to install centered on the center beam of a standard 4.5 x 10 ft trailer. It has to be turned to the side. If it were a half inch wider it would be perfect. There is no lock feature of security feature. Also, there are no bolts to hold the studs on so you have to tumblr with them to bolt the spare on.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher G.

customer_reviews.title: I know long have to carry spare tire inside auto.
customer_reviews.text: I like not having haul spare tire in my ve orderhicle. The area where I had to install this this spare tire bracket I had use a block of wood in order to install it to the side of trailer worked out great but now wood like a way to lock tire so it is not easily stolen.
customer_reviews.author: Dan White

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality & Value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my SeaDoo trailer and 12" spare tire. Arrived in perfect condition and was very easy to install, all of the necessary hardware came with the carrier. Quality appears to be very good and the welds some have complained about was very good on the carrier I received. This is a steal for the price and quality that you receive, would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Cbach

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and a must have for your spare.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and a must have for your spare. The reason for four stars is that it should come with lug nuts to attach the spare to the mount. I replaced all of my lug nuts when I replaced my tires and rims so I used two of them.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Paul

customer_reviews.title: Easy install.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. Installation was simple and easy. They fit around the frames of my trailers and holds the spare perfectly. I'm not sure what the negative reviews are all about. I guess some people just shouldn't own tools.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Dahl

customer_reviews.title: I initially mounted this to the tongue on my trailer ...
customer_reviews.text: I initially mounted this to the tongue on my trailer but my tongue is made from L-brackets and the tire wobbled. It was more than enough clearance just not stable. I removed it from the tongue and mounted it to the front wall of the trailer and not it is rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Dione

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: The low price belies the quality of this bracket. It is painted well and comes with all the hardware needed for installation and attachment of the spare tire. The brackets have ample holes to accommodate any trailer frame. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Duffer

customer_reviews.title: They strong,  they serve there porpoise,
customer_reviews.text: They work very well I welded mine on each of my trailers I also tack welded the studs to the plate, they are tough they will fit any rim and if the provided holes don't work for your special application just drilling one in plate that will work. walla!!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry M T

customer_reviews.title: What I needed.
customer_reviews.text: This fit perfectly inside the A frame of my trailer. I picked up two 1/2" jam nuts to lock the wheel bolts in place. Since I store the spare in the garage, I put the tapered nuts on a small carabiner and keep them attached to the wheel until I hit the road. Very decent price.
customer_reviews.author: brown61dawg

customer_reviews.title: Could be better, but satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Would be better if it included another set of 20-1/2 nuts. The lug nuts provided are also what hold the tire mount bolts in place so it is very cumbersome to mount the tire. I went out and purchased another set of nuts and a lug lock and problems were solved. Overall it's a sturdy design, but definitely an oversight with the lugs.
customer_reviews.author: joel

customer_reviews.title: Rust on welds.
customer_reviews.text: Its good what it is intended for. It develope rust on the welds in less than a month. Easy to install. Put the two upper bolts in loosely and hang on the bumper then install the lower bolts and tighten to your hearts content. Installed on my bumber but it was too low for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Big Cheese

customer_reviews.title: Product exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. Very well made, sturdy, and adjustable. It should easily fit just about any trailer/wheel combination. All hardware is provided. Product exceeded my expectations. Great seller. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Be Sure to get some 1/2" SAE nuts to hold the Lug Bolts.
customer_reviews.text: Was able to find a place on the trailer that would let the tire be clear of every thing. As others have said, You need to supply 2 1/2" SAE nuts to put on the Lug bolts to hold them in. The kit comes with flat washers, Lock washers and Lug nuts. Of course you can not use lock washers with Lug nuts. so you have to put the bolt thru the bracket install Flat Washers, Lock washers and the afore mentioned Hex nuts. Then you can put the wheel on and use the lug nuts to hold it.....
customer_reviews.author: Roy B.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: So happy with the first one, that I ordered another for our other trailer. Very reasonable priced. The only thing is with these being so flexible to fit different applications, the bolts that hold the carrier to our trailer frames are way too long. Will probably just cut them shorter so they are not a hazard. Certainly not a show stopper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I was looking into making something like this for myself, and once I saw this... I felt it was cheaper and easier to bolt this on. installs in a flash and got the spare out of my trailer for more space.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Installed under 30 minutes. I put rubber on frame to prevent scratches and rust. Also spray painted a couple of coats for extra rust protection. Mounted close to hitch so I could see rear boat tires incase of a flat.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Brunson

customer_reviews.title: Good product good price!
customer_reviews.text: Installed it on a Tractor Supply 6X8 utility trailer. I cut some of the bolts off for safety after installing it but It seems to be great for the price. Pretty happy with it.... I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: randy

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Just finished installing this. Great quality material! Only complaint is the diagram that was printed on the instruction manual was blurry, but a separate diagram was included that was much easier to read. They must've gotten this feedback already.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Garden

customer_reviews.title: Pile of junk!
customer_reviews.text: The welds are a joke! There is not one square part to this thing, as I’m everything is crooked the mount is 3/16” out of square the tube going up is pointed to one side. The bolt holes are not for the bolt pattern they claim, bolts are not pressed in so not easy to mount spare on it. I did not actually use this as I don’t want to risk spare tire coming off on road.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For 12 bucks you cant complain too much. However ...
customer_reviews.text: For 12 bucks you cant complain too much. However, the 4 bolts provided were too short to go through and be able to put nuts and washers through a standard 4 " bumper. I had to go to the local True Value hardware store to find the 5" bolts needed to fasten the bracket on the bumper. I tried Lowes and Home Depot both of which did not have 7/16" bolts. Other than that. I got the bracket installed and supported the tire and wheel .
customer_reviews.author: Geronimo1862

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Fits well on my Karavan 5x10 utility trailer. The carrier came out of the box scuffed up a bit and had a few dings so thus the 4-star rating. No one is really going to see it so no biggee. Overall though it seems solid and for the price I'm happy and I think you would be too.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price and adding the spare to the trailer instead of carrying it on the boat or in the back of the truck. Keep the mount clean and dry as much as possible. Powdered finishes don't stand up to salt water, especially in the South on the gulf.
customer_reviews.author: Fishin Bob

customer_reviews.title: Need 5 “ bolts for a RV 4x4 bumper
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the factory Tire mount on my RV 4x4 bumper. You need 5” bolts. I need a lower tire mount this one looks good and feels very sturdy. My spare mounted up no issues 14 “ tire for the rv. The best thing is the price and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Robert De

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Seems very sturdy and well made. I used it on a 3” by 3” trailer arm. For my size the attaching bracket was kind of large and bolts were too long and necessitated cutting which was a chore.
customer_reviews.author: Nick J.

product_meta.title: MAXXHAUL 70214 Powder Coat Black Trailer Spare Tire Carrier
product_meta.description: Our MaxxHaul Spare Tire Carrier quickly mounts to the tongue of your trailer to handle your trailer spare tire of up to 100 Pounds in weight. It holds 4-lug (4 on 4" bolt pattern) and 5-lug (5 on 4-1/2" bolt pattern) trailer wheels. Please note that it is not compatible with 5 on 4-3/4" or 5 on 5" bolt pattern.
feature_bullets: Holds 4-lug (4 on 4" bolt pattern) and 5-lug (5 on 4-1/2" bolt pattern) trailer wheels and not compatible with 5 on 4-3/4" or 5 on 5" bolt pattern
Mounts on trailer tongues up to 3 inch wide and 5 inch high
Angled and raised mount design makes this ideal for boat trailers as well
Durable powder coat finish to resist rust and corrosion

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars4,879 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
